nodes.text: The Sebiri language was the native tongue of the Sebiri species. It was mainly composed of grunts and multi-sylabbic staccato phrases, coupled with a hand gestures that made up the majority of their speech. As a result, the Sebiri were able to communicate silently with ease. Two words in the Sebiri language were "K'va't'uuk," meaning "gifts," and "L'ttuuk'chk," meaning "holy ground" or "forbidden land."
